record.title: MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--H.R. 2693
record.narrative:
MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--H.R. 2693 -- (Senate - September 28, 2007)

[Page: S12320]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, H.R. 2693 is at the desk and due for its second reading.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 2693) to direct the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to issue a standard regulating worker exposure to diacetyl.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I would object to any further proceedings at that time.

record.chair: Without objection, the bill will be placed on the calendar.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, this bill deals with something that has developed. We would never dream we would be working on it, but it appears to be very important. We have had a lot of deaths and people getting sick, the popcorn workers in America, which is a huge industry. We are going to try to see if we can set some standards so people do not get sick by virtue of working around popcorn.
